ghostPage.title: Our Projects
ghostPage.excerpt: It’s been clear from the beginning that the purpose of Hackers and Slackers has always been to be more than just a blog.
ghostPage.custom_excerpt: It’s been clear from the beginning that the purpose of Hackers and Slackers has always been to be more than just a blog.

authors.name: Todd Birchard
authors.bio: Product manager turned engineer with an ongoing identity crisis. Breaks everything before learning best practices. Completely normal and emotionally stable.

primary_author.name: Todd Birchard
primary_author.bio: Product manager turned engineer with an ongoing identity crisis. Breaks everything before learning best practices. Completely normal and emotionally stable.

ghostPage.plaintext:
This blog was started by accident with a single purpose in mind: keeping fine
talent together to create something larger. That said, our Slacker side has been
showing much more than our Hacker side lately. I’m looking at all of you.
Whatever, they literally will never even read this. Fuck em.

Despite the odds, H+S continues to grow at an overwhelming pace. As it does,
there will always be at least one person here posting projects, hoping for that
special someone to arrive that also gives a shit. Please save me.
ghostPage.html:
This blog was started by accident with a single purpose in mind: keeping fine talent together to create something larger. That said, our Slacker side has been showing much more than our Hacker side lately. I’m looking at all of you. Whatever, they literally will never even read this. Fuck em.

Despite the odds, H+S continues to grow at an overwhelming pace. As it does, there will always be at least one person here posting projects, hoping for that special someone to arrive that also gives a shit. Please save me.
ghostPage.codeinjection_foot:
<script>
$('[data-github]').each(function () {
  var _this = this;
  var repo = $(_this).data('github')

  fetch('https://api.github.com/repos/' + repo).then(function (response) {
    return response.json();
  }).then(function (response) {
    $(_this).find('[data-forks]').text(response.forks);
    $(_this).find('[data-stars]').text(response.stargazers_count);
  });
});
</script>
